**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth (Shangqing Taishang Jiuzhen Zhongjing Jiangsheng Shendan Jue)**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth*
Author unknown, approximately dating to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. One of the transmitted versions of the *Scripture of the Nine Perfections*. One scroll.
Source of the base text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth**

First, close the eyes and inwardly observe. If any deficiencies are perceived, then burn incense, sit upright, close the eyes, clasp the hands firmly over the knees, and with concentrated essence, visualize the host of spirits while reciting the incantation as prescribed above.

At dawn and midday, perform the visualization while seated upright, ensuring no one witnesses the practice. In all cases, inwardly observe and visualize just before closing the eyes.

On the first day of the lunar month at midnight, after visualizing the spirits, further visualize within the two eyes a white *qi*, the size of a chicken’s egg, suspended before the face. Momentarily, it transforms into two luminous mirrors, each nine inches in diameter, which illuminate the twenty-four spirits residing within the body, clearly and penetratingly. After a long while, recite the following prayer:

*"O Radiant Treasure Mirrors, disperse and transform your forms,
Illumine the primordial spirit, subdue the myriad demons.
Ascend to the Supreme Clarity, part the clouds and celestial veils,
Command a thousand spirits, seal the mountains and summon the rivers."*

After reciting the incantation, perform this practice once every five days. This is what is meant by "reexamining inner essence and gathering the five spirits." By consistently practicing this, calamities will not arise, and one will ascend to the rank of a lofty immortal.

The method of the "Brushing Youth" enables one to clearly perceive the Five Spirits of the Celestial Lord and the twenty-four spirits. Regularly, during the *jiazi*旬 (ten-day period), on the day of *gengwu*, at noon, take one *sheng* of pure water, add one *zhu* of true elixir, stir it counterclockwise twenty-one times, and recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious flow of crimson essence, first illuminating the eightfold brightness,
The host of body spirits all assemble, manifesting their forms.
Penetrating vision spans ten thousand *li*, reaching the nine numina at the center.
The Celestial Lord reflects the youth, refining my supreme essence."*

After reciting, face east and wash the eyes fourteen times. Those who practice this regularly will attain penetrating vision of the myriad spirits. The incantation should be whispered softly, and the eyes should be washed with water facing the lunar station, always toward the east.

---

**The Supreme Perfected’s Summons of the Five Celestial Bodies in the Grotto Chamber and the Secret Method of the Hidden Register of the Flying Soul in the Six Harmonies**
**The Jade Scripture and Precious Formula of the Supreme Pole Lord of the Southern Culmen**

At midnight, in perfect stillness, sit or lie as you wish. Compose the body, purify the heart, relax the breath, and harmonize the spirit. Close the eyes and inwardly visualize the Great White Star of the west, positioned above the two eyebrows, called the *Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace*. One *cun* above the eyebrows and one *cun* inward lies the *Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace*. On yang days, visualize the star above the left eyebrow; on yin days, above the right.

Next, visualize the Chen Star of the north, located in the *Dark Palace of the Celestial Minister* at the center of the heavens. The *Dark Palace of the Celestial Minister* lies one *cun* directly upward from the nose, five *fen* below the hairline.

Next, visualize the Wood Star of the east, located in the *Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass*. The *Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass* lies one *cun* behind the eyes and one *cun* inward. On yang days, visualize the star behind the left eye; on yin days, behind the right.

Next, visualize the Sparkling Deluder Star of the south, located in the *Jade Gate and Flourishing Chamber*. The *Jade Gate and Flourishing Chamber* lies five *fen* inward from the inner canthi of the two eyes. On yang days, visualize the star at the inner canthus of the left eye; on yin days, at the inner canthus of the right.

Next, visualize the Central Quelling Star, located in the *Golden Coffer, Yellow Chamber, and Long Valley*. The *Golden Coffer, Yellow Chamber, and Long Valley* lie at the center of the philtrum, two *fen* inward, with the star suspended as if strung above.

After completing the visualization, ensure the stars occupy their positions, and you will perceive them emitting rays of light and releasing five-colored mists that penetrate the entire body, inside and out, as if the essence of the stars gently enters within.

Then, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva twenty-five times, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Supreme Purple Palace, within I perceive the Celestial Lord,
The Great One merges in unity, the gate of the Purple Chamber.
Within the gate, radiance shines—this is the Three Origins.
The Three Origins congeal essence, giving rise to the Five Spirits.
Precious luminaries unfold their splendor, emitting light that pierces the dawn.
Essence transforms and accumulates, changing into an elder,
With a countenance of plain silk, clad in a green mantle and crimson skirt,
A flowing bell at the right, tiger-patterned talisman at the left,
Holding the Heavenly Net, scattering crimson and flying through the dawn,
Treading upon the Floral Canopy, exhaling rays that refine the body.
The Three Luminaries guard and protect, enabling me to attain perfection,
Nurturing the hun-soul and restraining the po-soul, riding the whirlwind to ascend as an immortal."*

After reciting, swallow saliva three more times and knock the teeth three times.

Those who consistently practice this method for fifteen years will be welcomed by the True One of the Crimson Mound of the Southern Culmen, the Supreme Elder, in a chariot of green clouds; by the Master of the Plain Mound of the Western Culmen, the White Elder, in a carriage of yellow whirlwinds; by the Supreme Immortal Emperor of the Northern Culmen, the Dark Elder, in a dragon of dark radiance; by the Duke of Supporting Yang of the Eastern Culmen, the Green Elder, in a palanquin of azure canopies; and by the Supreme Dark Child of the Central Origin, the Central Elder, in a canopy of winding dawn. When the Five Elders unite, they ascend together to the Purple Void.

Practice this without fail, and visualize with precision. Avoid treading upon filth, abstain from promiscuity, regularly burn incense, and frequently bathe. Those who violate these precepts will wither and decline; those who adhere will ascend as immortals.

After completing the visualization, if you have a wish, append it to the end of the incantation. When visualizing the five stars together, position them two *cun* below the nape, one *cun* to each side, with the stars as round as pellets, illuminating the body and face.

On the first, fifteenth, seventh, ninth, thirteenth, seventeenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth days of the lunar month, at cockcrow, visualize the images of the sun and moon within the *Soul Chamber of the Six Harmonies*. The *Soul Chamber of the Six Harmonies* lies in the small, elevated space above the outer corners of the two eyes. Press this point and knock the teeth; if you feel a movement beneath your fingers where the four meet, that is the location. One *cun* inward, nine *fen* square, it is called the *Mansion of the Soul Chamber of the Six Harmonies*.

With the sun on the left and the moon on the right, visualize their radiance illuminating the entire form, ensuring their semblance remains in place. Close the eyes and focus intently, allowing no lapse in concentration. Once complete, knock the teeth seven times, swallow saliva nine times, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Great luminous dawn,
Ninefold verdant ascent,
Summoning rosy clouds, concealing brilliance,
Refining the five forms,
Palace chariot of the Six Harmonies,
Seven spirits in harmony,
Let me ascend as an immortal,
My soul ascend to the Upper Clarity."*

Upon finishing the incantation, after practicing this for fifteen years, the Jade Emperor will dispatch the *Three Pure Ones’* chariot to welcome you.

One must raise a rooster that crows at dawn, ensuring it maintains regular timing. If practiced in concealment, the mutual radiance of the sun and moon will be lost.

The Southern Pole Lady received this method from the Most High Perfected, naming it *Dual Radiance Winging the Form in Hidden Visualization*. Only those with the bone structure of an immortal may hear and behold this scripture.

---

**The Supreme Reversion to the Hidden Dao: Inner Chapter for Removing Sins from the Register**

**The Jade Perfected’s Hidden Primordial Inner Vision**
On the *ding* days of the *Six Ding* cycle, during the hour of *sheng qi*, when the Celestial Primordial unfolds and the *bao* binds ever more firmly, the seven *po* ascend to speak, and the three *hun* record transgressions. For those who have violated the seven generations of ancestors and accumulated sins in the Three Yin realms, there exists a method of dissolution to absolve transgressions and sins.

This practice is for those who seek immortality.

Regularly, during the *jiazi* cycle, on the *dingmao* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

*"First Great Star,
Mysterious Pivot, Yang Brightness,
Celestial Pivot, Spirit of the Hun,
Nine Lords of the Upper Prime."*

After seven invocations, recite again:

*"May the yang sins and yin transgressions of my seven generations, down to my own self, all be dissolved. May all endeavors align with my wishes, and all affairs accord with my heart. May I ascend the Seven Primes, harmonize with Heaven, my name inscribed on the cinnabar tablets, my lifespan extended by billions."*

Once complete, visualize the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your heart. Visualize the starlight illuminating both within and without, focusing intently. This is called *dissolving the morning’s entangling net*, where inner and outer become empty and radiant, ascending the Dao.

During the *jiaxu* cycle, on the *dingchou* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

*"Second Prime Star,
Northern Terrace, Yin Essence,
Celestial Whirl, Spirit of the Hun,
Nine Lords of the Upper Jade."*

After seven invocations, recite again:

*"May the yang sins and yin transgressions of my seven generations, down to my own self, all be dissolved. May the Six Qi be full, the Four Spirits in emptiness. May I ascend the Seven Primes, my name inscribed in the Jade Book, ascend to the Purple Clarity, ride the void and harness the formless, moving freely and auspiciously, in harmony with Heaven."*

Once complete, visualize the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your lungs, illuminating both within and without, the five viscera distinctly visible. When the stars enter your mouth, your eyes should perceive their radiance scattering and filling your mouth, with a slight warmth—this is the sign of the stellar essence entering.

For all seven primes, visualize the Dao of the Nine Mornings. The bed and mat you sleep on must not be shared with others, nor should your clothing. If a man and woman share a mat to rest, their sins are recorded in the Northern Mystery’s register. If one violates defilement, calamity is inscribed in the earthly prison.

However, if a master and disciple of the same qi share a resting place, it is not considered a violation.

During the *jiashen* cycle, on the *dinghai* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

*"Third True Star,
Nine Ultimates, Supreme Perfected,
Celestial Mechanism, Essence of the Po,
Nine Lords of the Upper Simplicity."*

After seven invocations, recite again:

*"May the death sins and transgressions of my seven generations of ancestors and parents, down to my own self—accumulated evils, hidden faults, and violations against the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water—all be dissolved. May my eyes see clearly, penetrating the hidden and unseen. May I ascend the Seven Lords, my name inscribed in the Upper Clarity, command the myriad spirits, ascend to the Jade Court, ride the radiance and harness the void, harmonizing with Heaven."*

Once complete, visualize the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your liver, their light illuminating the five viscera, both within and without. Finish by visualizing facing north, bowing twice, then swallowing saliva nine times. One may also rise and bow.

During the *jiawu* cycle, on the *dingyou* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

*"Fourth Pivot Star,
Root-Spreading Mystery,
Celestial Balance, Essence of the Po,
Nine Lords of the Upper Void."*

After seven invocations, recite again:

*"May the sins of my seven generations, down to my own self—lacking kindness and virtue, unfilial and unbenevolent, the countless yin evils—all be dissolved. May I ingest essence and absorb qi, daily advancing. May I ascend the Seven Primes, my name inscribed in the Great Mystery, listed before the Jade Emperor, soaring through the Nine Heavens, commanding spirits and guiding numina, renewing the brightness of the sun and moon."*

Once complete, visualize the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your spleen, their radiance illuminating and penetrating, reflecting upon the five viscera. Finish by swallowing saliva fourteen times.

During the *jiachen* cycle, on the *dingwei* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

The Fifth Star of the Net, Heavenly Balance and Cinnabar Prime, Jade Balance and Spirit-Soul Supreme Lord, Supreme Mystery and Nine August Lords. Invoke it seven times, then recite the incantation:

*"May I be cleansed of all defilements and transgressions from seven generations past down to my present self—inner and outer impurities, hidden and manifest faults numbering thousands of millions, recorded in the Dark Pass—all dissolved. May my body be filled with qi, brimming in the Yellow Court, settling in the stomach, inscribed upon the Great Simplicity. May I ride the radiance to the Purple Palace, attended on the right by Jade Maidens and on the left by Jade Lads, sun and moon shining as one, my rank as True King."*

Finish by visualizing the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your stomach, their radiance illuminating and penetrating, reflecting upon the five viscera. Complete by swallowing saliva eighteen times.

During the *jiayin* cycle, on the *dingsi* day, at midnight, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing north, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars shining brightly in the north. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

The Sixth Star of the Cycle, Life’s Mechanism and Northern Pole, Opening Yang and Spirit-Soul, Supreme Cinnabar and Void Nine Lords. Invoke it seven times, then recite the incantation:

*"May I be absolved of all crimes and misdeeds from seven generations past down to my present self—treacherous evils, rebellious transgressions, and reckless offenses recorded in the Celestial Bureau—all dissolved. May the hundred ailments be healed, my body’s qi harmonized and upright, my name inscribed on the Terrace of Immortals, engraved upon the Golden Register of the Upper Clarity. May I command the ten thousand spirits and soar through the Nine Luminaries."*

Finish by visualizing the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and directly into your kidneys, their radiance illuminating and penetrating, the five viscera distinctly revealed. Complete by swallowing saliva fourteen times. On yang days, visualize the stars entering the left kidney; on yin days, the right. The first day is yang, the second yin. This practice strictly forbids exposure to blood, filth, or foul odors, or the consumption of meat and pungent foods. Violations will extend to the seven ancestors above and the practitioner below, resulting in death as a lesser ghost, their name erased from the Celestial Gate.

On the evening of the lunar month’s end, the following dawn marking the new moon, before the cock’s crow, sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, facing east, hands clasped. Knock the teeth seven times, then visualize the seven stars of the Northern Dipper shining brightly before your face. After a long while, softly recite the incantation:

The Seventh Star of the Barrier, Mysterious Yang and Heavenly Gate, Jade Radiance and Supreme Brilliance, Supreme Jade Emperor and Dao Lord. Invoke it seven times, then recite the incantation:

*"May I be cleansed of all hidden and obscured sins from seven generations past down to my present self—offenses incurring the Five Punishments, the spirits within my body numbering thousands of millions, recorded in the Ghost Bureau of the Northern Emperor—all dissolved. May my spirit be unimpeded in eight directions, seated in stillness or standing in vanishing, ears hearing the unheard, eyes emitting purple light. May I be inscribed upon the Jade Simplicity, peer into the forms of ghosts, my name recorded by the August Lord, my fate illumined by the Five Luminaries. May I soar through the Seven Primes and repose in the Purple Court."*

Finish by visualizing the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center, flying into your mouth and into your pupils, their light suffusing both eyes, revealing the inner and outer naturally, the five viscera distinctly visible. On yang days, visualize the stars entering the left pupil; on yin days, the right.

On *liujia* days, at the hour of midnight when generative qi arises, recline or sit upright on the bed in the sleeping chamber, head facing any direction. Clench the fists, hold the breath, and settle the spirit for a long while. Knock the teeth nine times, then visualize the nine stars of the Northern Dipper shining brilliantly above your crown. Let the light of the nine stars, with one star preceding the Dipper’s handle, radiate and intermingle. Then softly recite the incantation:

The Eighth August Star, Supreme Jade Emperor Spirit, Eight Effulgences Prime Lord, Nine Exalted Great Stars, Supreme Tenuity and Jade Emperor Spirit, Great Simplicity and Seven Dawns Prime Lord. Invoke it nine times, then recite the incantation:

*"May I be absolved of all sins—great and small—from nine generations of ancestors and parents down to my present self, from mountains to water sources, recorded in the Registers of the Dead, hidden evils, concealed treacheries, and deceits numbering in the millions, listed in the Ghost Emperor’s Fengdu, offenses under the statutes of death, inscribed in the Black Register of the Nine Primes and Supreme Ultimate True Persons of the Northern Heavens. I beseech the Nine Primes Supreme August Lord and Jade Mystery Lord to dissolve every transgression. May I soar through the Seven Paths, ascend to the Jade Clarity, wander the Great Primal, ride the radiance of dawn’s birth, feast in the Eight Simplicities of the North, rival the sun, jointly attend the August Consort, and command the ten thousand numina."*

Finish by visualizing the seven stars of the Northern Dipper descending from the celestial center into the Purple Chamber of the Muddy Pellet, their light illuminating the Muddy Pellet and suffusing the entire body and five viscera, generating purple clouds of qi within and without, dense and luxuriant. Complete by swallowing saliva twenty-seven times.

If *liujia* days, the last day of the lunar month, or *liuding* days coincide too closely, adjust the timing accordingly without undue frequency. Each practice must adhere strictly to the true method.

Here ends the Supreme Way of Returning to the Origin and Atoning for Sins. On the day the Supreme Lord concealed the Five Penetrations, they were sealed in the Jade Casket of the Five Peaks, the Hidden Way of Returning to the Origin concealed in the Palace of the Nine Dawns. Having cultivated the Five Penetrations, one must practice the Return to the Origin. The Five Penetrations are presented to the Emperor, the Return to the Origin initiated, and the Mysterious End revealed. Thus, those who cultivate the Five Penetrations and practice the Seven Primes’ Way of Return must abstain from consuming bloody or foul substances or encountering corpses and impurities. Violators will face the judgment of the Great Mystery.

The Five Penetrations mark the Supreme Lord’s auspicious assembly day. The Return to the Origin marks the Supreme Lord’s day of renewal. Without knowledge of the Five Penetrations, one cannot dissolve sins or eradicate evils. Without knowledge of the Hidden Way of Returning to the Origin, one’s name cannot be inscribed among the Upper Perfected.

On those designated days, one must reflect upon auspicious matters and first repent for the transgressions within one’s body—this is what is meant by "dissolving the bonds of seven generations and shedding the form and name." Yet this must not be revealed to the immortals within the Nine Palaces.

For those who cultivate the affairs of the Cavernous Chamber and the Purple Chamber, or who meditate upon the Nine Mornings and Seven Primes, at the moment of first rising from sleep or first lying down, during breathwork, or after meals, one should softly recite the incantation:

*"Five Stars, Five Penetrations,
Six Harmonies, Purple Chamber,
Return to the Origin, Hidden Way,
Vast and Radiant Seven Mornings.
The soul’s begetter is the Mysterious Father,
who transforms one into spirit;
the spirit’s begetter is the Mysterious Mother,
who shapes two into form.
The Duke’s Son governs my sinews and bones,
White Prime refines my essence and qi.
May I attain long life and enduring vision,
ascend as a flying immortal through the Ten Heavens."*

Once the incantation is complete, ensure no ear hears its sound. This is the Supreme Lord’s Hidden Incantation, used to dispel perverse qi, summon spirit and essence, and prevent lifelong weariness or confusion.

The *Scripture of the Nine True Sovereign Lords on the Nine Yin’s Convergence and Myriad Transformations in the Hidden Heavens* states: The *Nine Yin Scripture of the Sovereign Lord* says: Those who wish to transform, divide their form, vanish into the eight directions, conceal their body and hide their radiance, enter emptiness to create obscurity, summon the myriad things, or command and restrain demonic chiefs must constantly purify themselves and cultivate the Sovereign Lord’s Nine Yin’s refined contemplation.

Within the first star is the Palace of the Supreme Lord, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Inner Consort of Transformation, Concealment, and Return to the Origin, named **Taiyi Fada**, styled **Xing Zhengfu**. She wears a yellow brocade mantle, a vermilion-and-indigo flying skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the second star is the Palace of the Middle Origin, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Inner Concubine of Embryonic Protection and Form Transformation, named **Taiyi Sanweng**, styled **Luozhu Ying**. She wears a blue-green brocade mantle, a green-feathered flying floral skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the third star is the Palace of the True Origin, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Upper Prime Cinnabar Mother of the Six Vanishings and Seven Concealments, named **Taiyi Lingyi**, styled **Zhong Shuangzhao**. She wears a blue-green brocade mantle, an embroidered-feather flying floral skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the fourth star is the Palace of the Hidden Axis, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Inner Consort of Concealed Radiance and Hidden Light, named **Taiyi Qilie**, styled **Heng Danpan**. She wears a purple brocade mantle, a yellow-flowered feathered flying skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the fifth star is the Palace of the Stalwart Spirit, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Great Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, named **Taiyi Yushu**, styled **Chou Qiulan**. She wears a vermilion brocade mantle, a purple-and-indigo flying skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the sixth star is the Palace of the Recorded Luminance, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Middle Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, who conceals her traces and disperses the masses, named **Taiyi Qijing**, styled **Baoding Ling**. She wears a vermilion brocade mantle, a blue-green embroidered flying skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the seventh star is the Palace of the Convergent Assembly, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Lesser Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, who divides her shadow into myriad forms, named **Taiyi Yuhei**, styled **Tian Fanxiu**. She wears a cinnabar brocade mantle, a blue-green flowered feathered skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the eighth star is the Palace of the Sovereign’s Seat, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Left Consort of the Dipper’s Center, the High August One who transforms the sun, moon, water, and fire, named **Taiyi Shiqizhu**, styled **Luomaohua**. She wears a purple brocade mantle, an embroidered-feather flying skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the ninth star is the Palace of the Supreme Veneration, where resides the Sovereign Lord’s Right Consort of the Dipper’s Center, the High August One who transforms metal, stone, mountains, and rivers, named **Taiyi Aitiao**, styled **Yunyu**. She wears a green brocade mantle, a kingfisher-feathered floral skirt, and a trailing cloud coiffure.

Within the nine star-palaces of the Dipper, the names of the Nine Yin Consorts of the Sovereign Lord are concealed. When reciting the incantation, invoke only their titles and names; do not mention their attire, mantles, or anything below the head.

Those who master the Sovereign Lord’s Nine Yin will ascend to the Morning Upper Heavens, attaining the rank of Upper Perfected. At life’s end, they will not suffer the calamity of mourning, for the spirits of the Great Yin will guard and follow them, and the essences of the myriad spirits will bow in homage. They will disperse, transform, and merge, shaping heaven and earth.

These Nine Consorts of the Great Yin are the divine attendants of the Sovereign Lord’s Yin Palace. If one practices the Dao to untie knots, offers talismans to the celestial registers, pacifies the hun-soul and restrains the po-soul, transforms and generates the body’s spirits, guides the qi and extends the essence in pursuit of long life, yet remains ignorant of the names of the Sovereign Consorts and fails to practice the Nine Yin to achieve convergence, one will never attain immortality.

One inch inward from the space between the eyebrows lies the Hall of Luminance, a perfect square of one inch, where the Sovereign Lord’s Nine Yin Consorts perpetually reside.

On the even-numbered days of each month, at the hour of living qi during the evening, burn incense and enter a separate chamber. Sit or lie as you wish, close your eyes for a long while, and visualize the Sovereign Lord seated serenely within the Purple Chamber of the Great Ultimate. Then visualize the Five Spirits of Taiyi within the Six Harmonies, the Nine Stars of the Northern Dipper within your heart, and the Nine Yin Consorts within the Hall of Luminance. Next, visualize the Luminous Essence Lad of the Grand Tenuity standing before the Sovereign Lord, the lad holding the Five Talismans in his left hand and the Five Registers in his right. Then visualize your own form standing behind the lad, the Nine Yin Consorts emerging from the Hall of Luminance to stand in a row behind you, and the Five Spirits of Taiyi ascending from the Six Harmonies into the Purple Chamber of the Great Ultimate to stand in a row behind the Nine Yin Consorts.

Once all is complete, the Sovereign Lord and the host of spirits suddenly merge into a single transformation, assuming the form of a newborn infant. This is called the **Eternal Lad**, styled **Transforming Jade**, who holds the Nine Stars in his hand, wears the sun upon his head, and clasps the moon in his mouth. The lad bathes you in the radiance of the sun, moon, and Nine Stars, illuminating your entire body inside and out. You will feel your body suffused with crimson, as if engulfed in flames, with no distinction between inner and outer—all will be enveloped in a misty glow. This is the Sovereign Lord’s Taiyi Nine Yin, the Nine Yin’s convergence and transformation into myriad forms.

After a long while, conclude by knocking the teeth twenty-four times, swallowing saliva nine times, and softly reciting the incantation:

The radiance of the Grotto-Heavens’ divine light revolves, illuminating the Purple Clarity. The Nine Mornings of Mysterious Yin conceal themselves in the depths of darkness, where the Lady of the Dipper’s midst and the Three Maidens disperse their forms. The divine consorts transform within, and the myriad things instantly take shape. Lightning flashes and thunder crashes, clouds and mists drift and scatter. Ninety transformations arise, giving birth to cinnabar and sprouting verdant hues. The Nine Ladies of Taiyi transmute their palaces into a state of primordial fusion. The Eternal Lad roams freely, dwelling in the hidden depths of darkness. Adorned in brocade robes and resplendent coverings, with skirts of flying purple feathers, he bears a concealed talisman at his left side and a tiger-patterned sash at his right. He commands fire and wears fire, cradling a crimson banner in his arms. The Eight Winds of demon-subduing rage at his flanks, while the Four Quarters are drawn by luminous clouds. Carefree within the celestial net, he dissolves the Seven Primes, obscures mountains and rivers, and overturns the Five Mornings. The sun and moon dim their brilliance, and the constellations lose their true forms. Dividing his form into a hundred, he transforms his body into a thousand. Within fire, he becomes fire; entering the forest, he becomes the forest. Dwelling in water, he becomes water; entering the mountain, he becomes the mountain. Whatever is sought arrives in an instant; whatever is summoned appears before him. Desires are swiftly fulfilled, and wishes manifest at a glance. A thousand kinds and a thousand things follow the heart’s every word. When the Sovereign Lord takes form, the Jade Morning of the Most High, the Peerless One of shared radiance, the Four and the White Prime—all these arise with the birth of heaven and earth to protect and nurture my body. Whatever the mouth utters transforms in accordance with the will. Jade lads present talismans, Jade Flowers hold towels, divine consorts offer incense, and the Four Perfected share the same chariot. Every matter and every thing conforms to my words.

When the incantation is complete, visualize the Year Star, the Sparkling Deluder, the Grand White, the Chronographic Star, and the Quelling Star—altogether five stars—each arriving from their respective directions and entering your mouth. Let the radiant light of the Five Stars shine upward to illuminate the Purple Chamber of the Muddy Pellet, shine inward to illuminate the Five Viscera, and shine downward to illuminate the Yin Chamber, so that the entire body becomes thoroughly permeated.

This is the Sovereign Lord’s use of illumination to reverse the Dao of the Nine Yins.

After a long while of visualization, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva five times, and softly recite the incantation:

The Five Celestial Bodies array themselves in brilliance across the Five Directions.
The Water Star averts calamity; the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Sparkling Deluder dissolves misfortune; the Grand White repels weapons.
The Quelling Star secures the Four Quarters, granting me favorable divination.
The Sovereign Lord employs transformation to harmonize and reverse the Nine Spirits.
The White Blossom of Great Yin, the palace chambers of the Nine Stars,
inscribe my jade tablet and record my name in the Emperor’s chamber.
Riding the whirlwind and fanning the luminous clouds, I soar through the Great Void,
entering and exiting the unseen, roaming the Ten Directions of darkness.
Five-colored clouds cover me, summoning spirits and seizing the winds,
commanding the myriad spirits to serve and protect the Transcendent Lords above.

When finished, this is the hidden scripture of the Sovereign Lord’s Nine Yins, the inner practice of the Nine Perfected.

The ranks of the Five Spirits, the pathways of the Three Primes:
The Central Yellow Venerable Lord, the Southern Purple Essence Lord, the Eastern Azure Lad Lord, the Northern Most High Lord, and the Western Primordial Simplicity Lord—all reverse the Nine Yins to disperse their forms, deploy the Five Stars to extinguish their radiance, and blend and transform the myriad things, accomplishing all matters instantly. Those who long preserve and contemplate this become Perfected Ones above.

If the practitioner constantly cultivates this, their transformations will be boundless, and their body will generate water and fire.

Here ends the Dao of the Sovereign Lord’s Nine Yins.

**The Vermilion Writ of the Most High’s Jade Morning and the Rushing Solar Orb**
**The Yellow Writ of the Knotted Radiance and the Rushing Lunar Orb**

This Dao of the rushing sun and moon is treasured and kept secret by the Four Perfected Ones of the Most High’s Supreme Clarity and the Nine Sovereigns of the Great Ultimate, as well as the Jade Writs of the Mysterious Void Jade Lord. Unless one’s name is inscribed in the Golden Pavilion and recorded in the Eastern Florescence, one cannot hear or see the titles of these two chapters.

Those who practice this must first purify themselves with a hundred days of abstention, cutting off all worldly affairs. With prolonged cultivation, the sun and moon of the upper realms will grant fifty jade lads and fifty jade maidens each.

The *Vermilion Writ of the Most High’s Jade Morning* and the *Yellow Writ of the Knotted Radiance* are the sacred and secret scriptures of the Jade Sovereign Lord of the Most High. They are stored in the chambers of the Nine Heavens, upon the Cinnabar-Jasper Terrace. Unless one is diligent in heart and fond of the true, with the celestial bone-record of a Flying Mystery Heavenly Transcendent, one cannot see or hear of them. Even hearing their titles must not be spoken of carelessly, for to do so offends the Three Officials, and Heaven and Earth will not forgive.

Initially, the transmission was permitted to one person every three hundred years, then again after seven hundred years. If the spirits and darkness indicate one is fit to receive it, it may be transmitted. The method of transmission is passed from master to disciple in accordance with the exalted statutes of the Mysterious. If transmitted to an unworthy person who does not follow the regulations, it is considered a leak of celestial patterns. Those who violate the oath through negligence or disrespect will become lowly ghosts after death, and their seven generations of ancestors will suffer the punishment of wind and fire. Unless of the same vital breath, one should rather keep silent.

On the Western Mystery Mountain’s Terrace of Radiance, these two scriptures are inscribed on jade tablets in golden characters. In the Clear Void Heaven of Wangwu, they exist but are not complete. Only in the Highest Terrace of the Great Mystery Palace and the northern chamber of the Penglai Prefecture’s Golden Pillar and Jade Wall are the inscriptions fully preserved. The Transcendents of the Central Palace and the various palaces of the Great Clarity do not even know what these texts are.

On the northern cavern of Mount Emei’s stone chamber doorframe, an inscription in stone reads:
*"The Jade Morning draws the sun’s essence; the Knotted Radiance summons the moon’s spirit.
Attaining the Dao, one dwells in the Upper Palace, becoming a Perfected Sovereign Lord."*
These twenty characters are seen by lesser transcendents, who do not comprehend their meaning. Among such transcendents, many have never even seen the titles of these texts.

The Golden Liquid Divine Elixir is but a minor art, insufficient for ascending to the Upper Clarity. Those who wish to practice this Dao need not distinguish between foolishness and wisdom—only that such texts do not exist in the mortal realm. The true methods of the Mysterious Law are transmitted only after oaths are sworn. Those who obtain and practice them attain the rank of Upper Perfected, riding the Eight Radiance Jade Wheels to roam the Nine Mornings, journeying to the Primordial Purity Palace to behold the Supreme Unity Emperor Lord, together paying homage at the Origin Dawn. Thus, the secret words say: *"Only when you obtain the Jade Morning and Knotted Radiance do you become a Perfected of the Upper Clarity. Without cultivating the Supreme Dao, you cannot meet the Three Origin Lords."*

The Supreme’s Jade Morning Sun’s Five Emperors’ taboo names, courtesy names, and attire:
- **Sun’s Green Emperor**: Taboo name *Yuánchángwú*, courtesy name *Zhàolóngtāo*, clad in a green jade brocade mantle, azure floral flying-feather skirt, and a *Cuìróng Fúchén* crown.
- **Sun’s Red Emperor**: Taboo name *Dānlíngzhì*, courtesy name *Lǜhóngyìng*, clad in a descending-jade brocade mantle, vermilion floral flying-feather skirt, and a *Dān Fúlíngmíng* crown.
- **Sun’s White Emperor**: Taboo name *Hàoyùjiāng*, courtesy name *Huíjīnxiá*, clad in a plain jade brocade mantle, white feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Hàolíng Fúgài* crown.
- **Sun’s Black Emperor**: Taboo name *Chéngqīntíng*, courtesy name *Xuánlǜyán*, clad in a dark jade brocade mantle, black feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Xuánshān Fúróng* crown.
- **Sun’s Yellow Emperor**: Taboo name *Shòuyìfù*, courtesy name *Biāohuīxiàng*, clad in a yellow jade brocade mantle, yellow feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Fúlíng Zǐ* crown.

The above are the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Emperors within the sun.

To practice the sun-chasing Dao, one must recite and recognize their names, visualizing the emperors’ attire surrounding oneself in all directions.

The Moon’s Lady, spirit of the lunar essence, is named *Àixiāo Táibiāo*. The moon’s soul pairs with the Five Emperors, and one must also recite her name. Knowing the moon’s soul name ensures a life free from calamity, untouched by myriad harms.

The Supreme conceals the taboo names and courtesy names of the sun and moon emperors and their consorts within the Primordial Purity Moon Palace. Those who possess this knowledge become divine immortals.

The Supreme’s Knotted Radiance Moon’s Five Empresses’ taboo names, courtesy names, and attire:
- **Moon’s Green Empress**: Taboo name *Éyǐnzhū*, courtesy name *Fēnyàn Yīng*, clad in a green floral jade brocade mantle and a kingfisher-green dragon-phoenix flying-feather skirt.
- **Moon’s Red Empress**: Taboo name *Yìyìliáo*, courtesy name *Wǎnyánxū*, clad in a cinnabar-bud jade brocade mantle and a vermilion floral phoenix-falling flying-feather skirt.
- **Moon’s White Empress**: Taboo name *Língsùlán*, courtesy name *Yùliánhuá*, clad in a white jade four-dragon brocade mantle and a plain feather luan-pattern flying-floral skirt.
- **Moon’s Black Empress**: Taboo name *Jiéliánqiáo*, courtesy name *Tíngshǔjīn*, clad in a dark jade nine-cloud brocade mantle and a black feather dragon-pattern flying-floral skirt.
- **Moon’s Yellow Empress**: Taboo name *Qīngyíngjīn*, courtesy name *Xuándìngróng*, clad in a yellow cloud-mountain brocade mantle and a green feather phoenix-floral embroidered skirt.

All five empresses wear their hair in three-angled cloud buns, with the rest cascading to their waists.

The above are the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Empresses within the moon.

To practice the moon-chasing Dao, one must recite and recognize their names, visualizing the empresses’ attire surrounding oneself in all directions.

The sun’s soul, spirit of the solar essence, is named *Zhūjǐng Chìtóng*. The sun’s soul pairs with the moon’s Five Empresses, and one must also recite his name. Knowing the sun’s soul name ensures a life free from illness, untouched by myriad misfortunes. The Supreme conceals the names of the sun and moon souls within the Purple Void King’s Palace. Those who know them command spirits and wield numinous power.

Those who cultivate the sun- and moon-chasing Dao may practice as they see fit; it is not necessary to perform all rites. To attain a secluded chamber, one need only observe where the sun and moon first radiate. Those who do not sever worldly affairs or avoid external distractions cannot practice this Dao.

At midnight, one should always burn incense, visualize the Five Empresses’ names, and silently recite the incantation: *"May I unite with the Emperor Lords and the Five Spirits of the Supreme Unity, merging our radiance as one."* After twenty-four years of such practice, one may ascend to heaven in broad daylight, even without performing the chasing and visualization rites. Constantly visualize them at one’s left and right, reciting the old incantations silently, never aloud.

To practice the Jade Morning sun-chasing Dao, gaze at the sunrise each dawn. If the sun is not visible, remain in a quiet chamber, first closing the eyes and holding the breath for ten cycles, then swallowing the sun’s radiance ten times. Visualize the auroral light entering the mouth and swallow it. Afterward, softly call the Five Emperors’ names and the moon’s soul name three times in total.

Next, visualize the Green Emperor Lord emerging from the sunlight to stand at one’s left; then the Red Emperor Lord, from the sunlight to one’s right; then the White Emperor Lord, from the sunlight to one’s back; then the Black Emperor Lord, from the sunlight to one’s left hand; and finally the Yellow Emperor Lord, from the sunlight to one’s right hand. When all Five Emperors have arrived, visualize their attire in vivid detail.

Then, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva nine times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"Crimson furnace, cinnabar radiance, round blossom of ninefold brightness,
Supreme splendor dawns, resplendent with vermilion essence.
Five Emperors initiate the auroras, illuminating the myriad lives of the cavernous void.
Behold the descent of the Upper Perfected, vast and boundless as emptiness.
Circulate the qi, refine the hues, flowing through the five forms.
May my spirit transform, my six palaces flourish and fill,
Uniting with the Emperor Lords, the Supreme Unity’s peerless heroes.
Riding the crimson clouds, the yang mirror’s nine chariots,
Ascend to the sun’s heart, merging with the emperors’ numen.
May my lifespan equal heaven and earth, the two dawns converging."*

After the incantation, knock the teeth three more times, swallow saliva three times, and softly recite:
*"Moon soul, spirit essence, Àixiāo Táibiāo,
Grant me access to the sun’s cavernous heaven,
To the eastern Mount Meng’s long hills,
Where I receive the divine writ of the wielding spirit,
Bear the talisman of the nine realms,
Feast on the sun’s azure essence,
Drink the cloud-jade’s bloom,
Revel in the city of the eight poles,
Ascend the Terrace of Luminous Perfection,
Sit in the Hall of Rare Forests,
Chant the Jade Dawn’s verses."*

Upon completion, once more visualize the yang mirror’s crimson-cloud chariot, harnessed to nine red dragons, arriving before you from the sunlight. Then, together with the Five Emperors, mount it and hasten toward the sun. Forget your form for a long while, then swallow saliva fourteen times. When finished, open your eyes and concentrate intensely, visualizing until faint outlines appear. Those who persist in this practice will surely ride the radiance to the sun—thus concludes the Way of Yūyí.

To perform the Way of Jiélín and hasten to the moon, gaze toward the moon each evening. When the moon is absent, sit in a quiet chamber, close your eyes, hold your breath for nine breaths, then swallow moonlight nine times. Visualize the moonlight entering your mouth and swallow it. Recite the names of the Five Vast Ladies and the sun’s soul, three times in all. Next, visualize the Azure Emperor’s Lady descending from the moonlight, with attendants arrayed to left and right, following the same method as the visualization of the Five Emperors within the sun. When all have arrived, visualize their robes and colors in vivid detail. Then knock the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and softly recite:

*"Essence of yellow radiance, primordial yin’s inner pattern,
Illumining the Great Mystery, opening the myriad realms,
Dispersing the misty cold winds, the Seven Dawns suspend jade,
The threefold yin revolves, heaven and earth exhale light,
Purple luminaries drift and descend, floating blossoms fill the nine voids,
Round brightness bestows hues, the six qi transform and flow,
The Five Emperor Ladies tread clouds and grasp winds,
Spirit veils of dense silk, jade pendants and earrings,
Feather skirts brush the clouds, transcendent fans stir the east,
Canopy trees spread their shade, jade branches flourish like lotus,
Cloud toads refine and polish, nurturing the Tree King,
Its roots stretch ten thousand leagues, casting shade over my body,
Soul harmonized, spirit transformed, the six mysteries brim with numen.
Those who return revert to infancy, jade radiance restores youth,
The Emperor Lords merge and transform, together with the radiant peach of health,
Timely riding the flowing bells, ten dragons of flying clouds,
Ascend to the Luminous Palace, attaining the rank of Guardian Sovereign,
Lifespan conjoined with the two images, heaven and earth without end."*

When finished, knock the teeth seven more times, swallow saliva seven times, and softly recite:

*"Sun soul, spirit essence, Pearl Radiance Red Youth,
Grant me passage west to the Six Peaks’ gate,
Entering the Jade Palace of Harmonious Dawn,
The Eight Chords’ White Hills, the Eight Radiance’ upper chambers,
To bear the talisman of Ten Brightnesses,
Wear the writ of the shooting star’s night glow,
Sit in the Hall of Supreme Harmony,
Ascend the Terrace of Seven Numinous Ones,
Drink the moon’s blossom cream,
Feast on the yellow jade’s purple nectar,
Chant the verses of the Lofty Ones,
Recite the Jade Dawn’s true hymns."*

Upon completion, visualize the flowing-bell flying-cloud chariot, harnessed to ten yellow dragons, arriving before you from the moonlight. Then, together with the Five Ladies, mount it and hasten toward the moon. Forget your form for a long while, then swallow saliva thirty times. When finished, open your eyes and concentrate intensely, visualizing until faint outlines appear. Those who persist in this practice will surely ride the radiance to the moon—thus concludes the Way of Jiélín.

If one has already attained the Dao and perfected the refinement of essence and visualization, practicing this for two years will yield faint outlines; in three years, the form will appear; in five years, one may hasten to the sun and moon. For those who are not yet immortals but begin this practice in earnest, progress will not be swift. Yet with prolonged cultivation, one may ascend to the Two Radiant Ones and become a Perfected of Highest Clarity. This transmission is bestowed upon one person every seven hundred years.

Here ends the *Highest Clarity Supreme Nine Perfected Central Scripture: Crimson Life-Spirit Elixir Formula*.

chunks.original_text: 上清太上九真中经绛生神丹诀 经名：上清太上九真中经绛生神丹诀。 撰人不详，约出於南北朝。 系《九真中经》传本之一。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 上清太上九真中经绛生神丹诀 先闭目内视，知如有不具，便当烧平坐闭目，握固两膝上，精存众神，咒行如上法。 其平旦、中时存神，自平坐而行之，勿令有见之者矣。 皆内视，临闭而存也。 月一日夜半存神讫，又存两目中有白气，如鸡子大，在面目前，须臾变成两明镜，径九寸，以前后照我一体上二十四神，洞鉴分明，良久，乃心祝曰： 大明宝镜，分形散化，鉴朗元神，制却万魔，飞行上清，披云巾罗，役使千灵，封山召河。 咒毕，五日一行之。 所谓覆校内精，检敛五神者也。 常能行之，灾害不生，而位登高仙。 拂童之道，使彻见帝君五神，及二十四神之法。 常以甲子之旬，庚午之日，日中之时，取清水一升，以一铢真丹投水中搅之，左行三七过，咒曰： 玄流朱津，先光八明，身神众列，并来见形，彻视万里，中达九灵，帝君映童，使我上精。 咒毕，东向，以洗目二七过。 常行之者，彻视万神。 咒当微言，以水向月建洗目，常向东。 太上真人招五辰於洞房籍飞魂於六合隐存秘道 南极元君玉经宝诀 夜半清静，坐卧任意，安体净心，宽气调神，临目内视，存西方太白星，在面两眉上，名为玉珰紫阙。 眉上一寸直入一寸，为玉珰紫阙。 阳日存星在左眉上，阴日存星在右眉上， 次又存北方辰星，在天中帝卿玄宫。 帝卿玄宫，从鼻直上，未至发际五分，直入一寸。 次又存东方木星，在洞关朱台。 洞关朱台，在目后一寸直入一寸。 阳日存星左目后，阴日存星右目后。 次存南方荧惑星，在玉门华房。 玉门华房，在两目内眦际五分，直入五分。 阳日存星在左目眦际，阴日存星在右月眦际。 次又存中央镇星，在金匮黄室长谷。 金匮黄室长谷，在鼻人中中央，直入二分，星如缀悬於上。 存思都讫，仿髴令星处其位，当觉使五星出光芒，放五色烟，贯我一身，洞彻内外，体中如有熏熏星精来入也。 乃叩齿五通，咽液二十五过讫，乃微咒曰： 高上紫阙，内见帝君，太一混合，紫房之门，门内焕明，是为三元，三元结精，乃有五神，宝曜敷晖，放光冲晨，精化积生，变为老人，首建素容，绿帔绛裙，右带流铃，左佩虎文，手把天纲，散绛飞晨，足蹑华盖，吐芒练身，三景保守，令我得真，养魂制魄，乘飙飞仙。 咒毕，又咽液三过，叩齿三通。 常能行此道十五年者，於是南极老人丹陵上真，迎以绿云之舆； 西极老人素陵子期，迎以黄飙之车； 北极老人玄上仙皇，迎以玄景之龙； 东极老人扶阳公子，迎以青軿之辇； 中元老人中央上玄子，迎以曲晨之盖。 五老人一合，俱升紫虚。 行之勿令不常也，存之勿令不精。 忌履秽，禁杂处，常熏香，数沐浴，违之者雕败，顺之者飞仙。 存毕而欲有所愿在意，於咒后续言之。 存五星共言止处，直入项下二寸，仍辟方一寸，星如弹圆，照洞面体。 月旦、月望、月七日、月九日、月十三日，月十七日、月二十日、月二十五日，鸡鸣时，存日月之象，在魂房六合。 魂房六合，在两目外之上角小仰高空之中，按之叩齿，闻手下有四会动在其下者是也，直入一寸，方九分，名曰魂房六合之府。

**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth (Shangqing Taishang Jiuzhen Zhongjing Jiangsheng Shendan Jue)**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth*
Author unknown, approximately dating to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. One of the transmitted versions of the *Scripture of the Nine Perfections*. One scroll.
Source of the base text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Perfections: The Crimson Elixir of Divine Birth**

First, close the eyes and inwardly observe. If any deficiencies are perceived, then burn incense, sit upright, close the eyes, clasp the hands firmly over the knees, and with concentrated essence, visualize the host of spirits while reciting the incantation as prescribed above.

At dawn and midday, perform the visualization while seated upright, ensuring no one witnesses the practice. In all cases, inwardly observe and visualize just before closing the eyes.

On the first day of the lunar month at midnight, after visualizing the spirits, further visualize within the two eyes a white *qi*, the size of a chicken’s egg, suspended before the face. Momentarily, it transforms into two luminous mirrors, each nine inches in diameter, which illuminate the twenty-four spirits residing within the body, clearly and penetratingly. After a long while, recite the following prayer:

*"O Radiant Treasure Mirrors, disperse and transform your forms,
Illumine the primordial spirit, subdue the myriad demons.
Ascend to the Supreme Clarity, part the clouds and celestial veils,
Command a thousand spirits, seal the mountains and summon the rivers."*

After reciting the incantation, perform this practice once every five days. This is what is meant by "reexamining inner essence and gathering the five spirits." By consistently practicing this, calamities will not arise, and one will ascend to the rank of a lofty immortal.

The method of the "Brushing Youth" enables one to clearly perceive the Five Spirits of the Celestial Lord and the twenty-four spirits. Regularly, during the *jiazi*旬 (ten-day period), on the day of *gengwu*, at noon, take one *sheng* of pure water, add one *zhu* of true elixir, stir it counterclockwise twenty-one times, and recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious flow of crimson essence, first illuminating the eightfold brightness,
The host of body spirits all assemble, manifesting their forms.
Penetrating vision spans ten thousand *li*, reaching the nine numina at the center.
The Celestial Lord reflects the youth, refining my supreme essence."*

After reciting, face east and wash the eyes fourteen times. Those who practice this regularly will attain penetrating vision of the myriad spirits. The incantation should be whispered softly, and the eyes should be washed with water facing the lunar station, always toward the east.

---

**The Supreme Perfected’s Summons of the Five Celestial Bodies in the Grotto Chamber and the Secret Method of the Hidden Register of the Flying Soul in the Six Harmonies**
**The Jade Scripture and Precious Formula of the Supreme Pole Lord of the Southern Culmen**

At midnight, in perfect stillness, sit or lie as you wish. Compose the body, purify the heart, relax the breath, and harmonize the spirit. Close the eyes and inwardly visualize the Great White Star of the west, positioned above the two eyebrows, called the *Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace*. One *cun* above the eyebrows and one *cun* inward lies the *Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace*. On yang days, visualize the star above the left eyebrow; on yin days, above the right.

Next, visualize the Chen Star of the north, located in the *Dark Palace of the Celestial Minister* at the center of the heavens. The *Dark Palace of the Celestial Minister* lies one *cun* directly upward from the nose, five *fen* below the hairline.

Next, visualize the Wood Star of the east, located in the *Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass*. The *Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass* lies one *cun* behind the eyes and one *cun* inward. On yang days, visualize the star behind the left eye; on yin days, behind the right.

Next, visualize the Sparkling Deluder Star of the south, located in the *Jade Gate and Flourishing Chamber*. The *Jade Gate and Flourishing Chamber* lies five *fen* inward from the inner canthi of the two eyes. On yang days, visualize the star at the inner canthus of the left eye; on yin days, at the inner canthus of the right.

Next, visualize the Central Quelling Star, located in the *Golden Coffer, Yellow Chamber, and Long Valley*. The *Golden Coffer, Yellow Chamber, and Long Valley* lie at the center of the philtrum, two *fen* inward, with the star suspended as if strung above.

After completing the visualization, ensure the stars occupy their positions, and you will perceive them emitting rays of light and releasing five-colored mists that penetrate the entire body, inside and out, as if the essence of the stars gently enters within.

Then, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva twenty-five times, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Supreme Purple Palace, within I perceive the Celestial Lord,
The Great One merges in unity, the gate of the Purple Chamber.
Within the gate, radiance shines—this is the Three Origins.
The Three Origins congeal essence, giving rise to the Five Spirits.
Precious luminaries unfold their splendor, emitting light that pierces the dawn.
Essence transforms and accumulates, changing into an elder,
With a countenance of plain silk, clad in a green mantle and crimson skirt,
A flowing bell at the right, tiger-patterned talisman at the left,
Holding the Heavenly Net, scattering crimson and flying through the dawn,
Treading upon the Floral Canopy, exhaling rays that refine the body.
The Three Luminaries guard and protect, enabling me to attain perfection,
Nurturing the hun-soul and restraining the po-soul, riding the whirlwind to ascend as an immortal."*

After reciting, swallow saliva three more times and knock the teeth three times.

Those who consistently practice this method for fifteen years will be welcomed by the True One of the Crimson Mound of the Southern Culmen, the Supreme Elder, in a chariot of green clouds; by the Master of the Plain Mound of the Western Culmen, the White Elder, in a carriage of yellow whirlwinds; by the Supreme Immortal Emperor of the Northern Culmen, the Dark Elder, in a dragon of dark radiance; by the Duke of Supporting Yang of the Eastern Culmen, the Green Elder, in a palanquin of azure canopies; and by the Supreme Dark Child of the Central Origin, the Central Elder, in a canopy of winding dawn. When the Five Elders unite, they ascend together to the Purple Void.

Practice this without fail, and visualize with precision. Avoid treading upon filth, abstain from promiscuity, regularly burn incense, and frequently bathe. Those who violate these precepts will wither and decline; those who adhere will ascend as immortals.

After completing the visualization, if you have a wish, append it to the end of the incantation. When visualizing the five stars together, position them two *cun* below the nape, one *cun* to each side, with the stars as round as pellets, illuminating the body and face.

On the first, fifteenth, seventh, ninth, thirteenth, seventeenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth days of the lunar month, at cockcrow, visualize the images of the sun and moon within the *Soul Chamber of the Six Harmonies*. chunks.original_text: 洞天神光，回耀紫清，玄阴九晨，隐沦绝冥，斗中夫人，三女散形，神妃内化，万物立成，电光雷激，云雾流零，九十变化，生丹起青，太一九女，宫变混淳，无常纵沦，遂馆幽冥，锦帔华被，紫羽飞裙，左佩隐符，右带虎文，御火戴火，手抱绛幡，旁魔八风，四掣景云，逍遥天纲，化荡七元，弊匿山河，颠迥五晨，日月塞晖，列宿失真，分形作百，化躯入千，在火成火，入林为林，居水为水，入山为山，所求忽至，所召已前，鲦欻适心，盼目立臻，千种千物，随心所言，帝君在形，太上玉晨，无英同景，四及白元，水生天地，保养我身，口有所道，逐意化迁，玉童奉符，玉华执巾，神妃献香，四真同轩，事事物物，皆如我言。 咒毕，又存岁星、荧惑星、太白星、辰星、镇星，一合凡五星，各从方面，俱来入口中，使五星光芒，上照泥丸紫房中，中照五藏，下照阴室，使一身之形，皆使洞彻。 此为帝君用明，以回九阴之道也。 存念良久，叩齿五通，咽液五过，乃微咒曰： 五辰列横，焕朗五方，水星却灾，木星致昌，荧惑消祸，太白辟兵，镇星四据，我得利贞，帝君用化，和回九灵，太阴素华，宫馆九星，记我玉简，录字帝房，乘飙扇景，飞腾太空，出入冥无，游冥十方，五云覆盖，招神摄风，役使万灵，上卫仙公。 毕。 此帝君九阴隐书，九真之内事也。 五神之阶级，三元之涂路。 中央黄老君、南方紫精君、东方青童君、北方太上君、西方太素君，并回九阴以散形，布五星以灭景，混变万物，触事立成，长存久视，上为真人者也。 若兆常能行之，则变化无方，身生水火。 於是帝君九阴之道毕。 太上玉晨郁仪奔日赤景玉文结璘奔月黄景玉章 右奔日月之道，太上上清太极九皇四真人之所宝秘，玄虚玉君之玉章也。 自非自金阁玉名，及录字东华，皆不可闻见此二章之篇目矣。 行之者先清斋百日，绝交人事，乃为之。 久久行之，上界日月得给玉童玉女各五十人。 太上郁仪赤文、结璘黄章，乃太上玉帝君灵秘篇也，藏之於九天之房，丹瑶之台，非懃心好真，宿有飞玄天仙之骨录者，莫得见闻。 闻其篇目，皆不可妄言，称及犯三官，天地不赦。 初令三百年得宣传一人，却七百年，乃复得传，若神冥告有宜授者，传之也。 传授之法，皆师友相受，以崇玄科也。 授非其人，不遵法度，为泄天文也。 漏慢违誓，死为下鬼，乃七祖考受风火之罪，自非同气，宁当闭口。 西玄山洞台中，有此二经，刻以玉简，书以金字。 及王屋清虚天，皆有而不备具，唯太玄宫高上台，及蓬莱府北室金柱玉壁，刻文并备具也。 中宫仙人、太清诸宫，并不知此书是何事也。 峨嵋山北洞中石室户枢，刻石书字曰：郁仪引日精，结璘致月神，得道处上宫，位为帝君真。 凡二十字，下仙见之，甚自不解其义是何事也。 如此仙人中，有不见其篇目者多也。

**The Yellow Writ of the Knotted Radiance and the Rushing Lunar Orb**

The Golden Liquid Divine Elixir is but a minor art, insufficient for ascending to the Upper Clarity. The true methods of the Mysterious Law are transmitted only after oaths are sworn. Those who obtain and practice them attain the rank of Upper Perfected, riding the Eight Radiance Jade Wheels to roam the Nine Mornings, journeying to the Primordial Purity Palace to behold the Supreme Unity Emperor Lord, together paying homage at the Origin Dawn. Thus, the secret words say: *"Only when you obtain the Jade Morning and Knotted Radiance do you become a Perfected of the Upper Clarity. Without cultivating the Supreme Dao, you cannot meet the Three Origin Lords."*

The Supreme’s Jade Morning Sun’s Five Emperors’ taboo names, courtesy names, and attire:
- **Sun’s Green Emperor**: Taboo name *Yuánchángwú*, courtesy name *Zhàolóngtāo*, clad in a green jade brocade mantle, azure floral flying-feather skirt, and a *Cuìróng Fúchén* crown.
- **Sun’s Red Emperor**: Taboo name *Dānlíngzhì*, courtesy name *Lǜhóngyìng*, clad in a descending-jade brocade mantle, vermilion floral flying-feather skirt, and a *Dān Fúlíngmíng* crown.
- **Sun’s White Emperor**: Taboo name *Hàoyùjiāng*, courtesy name *Huíjīnxiá*, clad in a plain jade brocade mantle, white feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Hàolíng Fúgài* crown.
- **Sun’s Black Emperor**: Taboo name *Chéngqīntíng*, courtesy name *Xuánlǜyán*, clad in a dark jade brocade mantle, black feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Xuánshān Fúróng* crown.
- **Sun’s Yellow Emperor**: Taboo name *Shòuyìfù*, courtesy name *Biāohuīxiàng*, clad in a yellow jade brocade mantle, yellow feather flying-floral skirt, and a *Fúlíng Zǐ* crown.

The above are the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Emperors within the sun.

To practice the sun-chasing Dao, one must recite and recognize their names, visualizing the emperors’ attire surrounding oneself in all directions.

The Moon’s Lady, spirit of the lunar essence, is named *Àixiāo Táibiāo*. The moon’s soul pairs with the Five Emperors, and one must also recite her name. Knowing the moon’s soul name ensures a life free from calamity, untouched by myriad harms.

The Supreme conceals the taboo names and courtesy names of the sun and moon emperors and their consorts within the Primordial Purity Moon Palace. Those who possess this knowledge become divine immortals.

The Supreme’s Knotted Radiance Moon’s Five Empresses’ taboo names, courtesy names, and attire:
- **Moon’s Green Empress**: Taboo name *Éyǐnzhū*, courtesy name *Fēnyàn Yīng*, clad in a green floral jade brocade mantle and a kingfisher-green dragon-phoenix flying-feather skirt.
- **Moon’s Red Empress**: Taboo name *Yìyìliáo*, courtesy name *Wǎnyánxū*, clad in a cinnabar-bud jade brocade mantle and a vermilion floral phoenix-falling flying-feather skirt.
- **Moon’s White Empress**: Taboo name *Língsùlán*, courtesy name *Yùliánhuá*, clad in a white jade four-dragon brocade mantle and a plain feather luan-pattern flying-floral skirt.
- **Moon’s Black Empress**: Taboo name *Jiéliánqiáo*, courtesy name *Tíngshǔjīn*, clad in a dark jade nine-cloud brocade mantle and a black feather dragon-pattern flying-floral skirt.
- **Moon’s Yellow Empress**: Taboo name *Qīngyíngjīn*, courtesy name *Xuándìngróng*, clad in a yellow cloud-mountain brocade mantle and a green feather phoenix-floral embroidered skirt.

All five empresses wear their hair in three-angled cloud buns, with the rest cascading to their waists.

The above are the taboo names, courtesy names, and attire of the Five Empresses within the moon.

To practice the moon-chasing Dao, one must recite and recognize their names, visualizing the empresses’ attire surrounding oneself in all directions.

The sun’s soul, spirit of the solar essence, is named *Zhūjǐng Chìtóng*. The sun’s soul pairs with the moon’s Five Empresses, and one must also recite his name. Knowing the sun’s soul name ensures a life free from illness, untouched by myriad misfortunes. The Supreme conceals the names of the sun and moon souls within the Purple Void King’s Palace. Those who know them command spirits and wield numinous power.

Those who cultivate the sun- and moon-chasing Dao may practice as they see fit; it is not necessary to perform all rites. To attain a secluded chamber, one need only observe where the sun and moon first radiate. Those who do not sever worldly affairs or avoid external distractions cannot practice this Dao.

At midnight, one should always burn incense, visualize the Five Empresses’ names, and silently recite the incantation: *"May I unite with the Emperor Lords and the Five Spirits of the Supreme Unity, merging our radiance as one."* After twenty-four years of such practice, one may ascend to heaven in broad daylight, even without performing the chasing and visualization rites. Constantly visualize them at one’s left and right, reciting the old incantations silently, never aloud.

To practice the Jade Morning sun-chasing Dao, gaze at the sunrise each dawn. If the sun is not visible, remain in a quiet chamber, first closing the eyes and holding the breath for ten cycles, then swallowing the sun’s radiance ten times. Visualize the auroral light entering the mouth and swallow it. Afterward, softly call the Five Emperors’ names and the moon’s soul name three times in total.

When all Five Emperors have arrived, visualize their attire in vivid detail.

Then, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva nine times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"Crimson furnace, cinnabar radiance, round blossom of ninefold brightness,
Supreme splendor dawns, resplendent with vermilion essence.
Five Emperors initiate the auroras, illuminating the myriad lives of the cavernous void.
Behold the descent of the Upper Perfected, vast and boundless as emptiness.
Circulate the qi, refine the hues, flowing through the five forms.
May my spirit transform, my six palaces flourish and fill,
Uniting with the Emperor Lords, the Supreme Unity’s peerless heroes.
Riding the crimson clouds, the yang mirror’s nine chariots,
Ascend to the sun’s heart, merging with the emperors’ numen.
May my lifespan equal heaven and earth, the two dawns converging."*

After the incantation, knock the teeth three more times, swallow saliva three times, and softly recite:
*"Moon soul, spirit essence, Àixiāo Táibiāo,
Grant me access to the sun’s cavernous heaven,
To the eastern Mount Meng’s long hills,
Where I receive the divine writ of the wielding spirit,
Bear the talisman of the nine realms,
Feast on the sun’s azure essence,
Drink the cloud-jade’s bloom,
Revel in the city of the eight poles,
Ascend the Terrace of Luminous Perfection,
Sit in the Hall of Rare Forests,
Chant the Jade Dawn’s verses."*

To perform the Way of Jiélín and hasten to the moon, gaze toward the moon each evening. When the moon is absent, sit in a quiet chamber, close your eyes, hold your breath for nine breaths, then swallow moonlight nine times. Visualize the moonlight entering your mouth and swallow it. *"Essence of yellow radiance, primordial yin’s inner pattern,
Illumining the Great Mystery, opening the myriad realms,
Dispersing the misty cold winds, the Seven Dawns suspend jade,
The threefold yin revolves, heaven and earth exhale light,
Purple luminaries drift and descend, floating blossoms fill the nine voids,
Round brightness bestows hues, the six qi transform and flow,
The Five Emperor Ladies tread clouds and grasp winds,
Spirit veils of dense silk, jade pendants and earrings,
Feather skirts brush the clouds, transcendent fans stir the east,
Canopy trees spread their shade, jade branches flourish like lotus,
Cloud toads refine and polish, nurturing the Tree King,

Soul harmonized, spirit transformed, the six mysteries brim with numen.
Those who return revert to infancy, jade radiance restores youth,
The Emperor Lords merge and transform, together with the radiant peach of health,
Timely riding the flowing bells, ten dragons of flying clouds,
Ascend to the Luminous Palace, attaining the rank of Guardian Sovereign,
Lifespan conjoined with the two images, heaven and earth without end."*

Recite the Jade Dawn’s true hymns."*
